cab.content:
THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT).
SECRET.
G.T.-4201.
WAR CABINET.
INTER-ALLIED COUNCIL ON WAR PURCHASES AND FINANCE.
Copy of letter No. 466 from the American Ambassador, to Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs.
American Embassy,
LONDON,
April 4th, 1918.
Sir,
Pursuant to instructions which I have just received by telegraph from my Government, I have the honour to acquaint you that the President has appointed Mr. James H. Skinner to be the representative of the United Status Food Administration on the Inter-Allied Council.
Mr. Skinner is on the point of proceeding to England accompanied by his wife and a secretary, and expects to sail from New York on the s.s. LAPLAND.
I have the honour to be,
with the highest consideration,
Sir,
Your most obedient humble Servant,
(Signed) WALTER HINES PAGE.
The Right Hon.
A. J. Balfour, O.M.
&C., &C., &C.
